title: Need some help
body:
Okay so I put in a support ticket for an issue and then ended up with worse so I'm over that... Figured i would appeal to you guys for help. 

This issue began with the preseason update

I'll be in game going fine and then hit 200-330 ms for a few seconds during the game and then back down. It'll happen 2-3 times during the game. I am on Ethernet , On a good computer and on a secure network. Tried everything on my end to solve the issue so if you have ideas of what it could be or a possible fix or even the same issue please... Let me know how to mitigate this.

Comp specs
i7-4790k
gtx 1070
16 gb ram
1tb HD (bulk storage)
then another 500 gb SSD (Which the game runs off of)

ISP: Cox

Edits: 

I kept a resource monitor open during a game and nothing spiked in resources or demanded bandwidth when this occurred each time.

Disabled all non windows services.. Problem persisted.

Got rid of Razer bloatware. Problem persisted

replies.body:
It does seem like there's some pretty in-depth troubleshooting going on in that ticket, and I'd hate to end up steering you in the opposite or wrong direction. Since you're this far into troubleshooting this with those techs I'd definitely stay in touch with them.

For my own opinion since you're here, I'm curious to know how League would run if it were installed on the *default* HD. Could you reinstall it there if possible and test how it runs there?
It was the same issue thus why i used the Hextech repair tool for a clean uninstall/reinstall to the new drive.
